title: pwd
description: Tells you the patrh to the current directory you are in

title: ls [file]
description: Lists files within file or if file is ommited lists files within current directory

title: cd [file]
description: Navigates to a new file, if file is empty or ~ this command will take you back to your home folder. file paths are relative unless an absaloute path is given (eg cd /home/username/documents or cd ~/documents)

title: mv [file1] [file2]
description: Move file1 to file2, this is also used to rename a file

title: rm [file]
description: deletes a file (NOTE: the file will be deleted and not go to a recycle bin)

title: rm -r [file]
description: Recursively deletes a folder and everything inside it (NOTE: the file will be deleted and not go to a recycle bin)

title: cat [file]
description: Prints the contents of the file to console

title: man [command]
description: Shows a manual page for a given command
